reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports on 1 May 2024 and 15 October 2024
summary:
The Security Council:

Reaffirms previous resolutions and Presidential statements on Abyei and the Sudan-South Sudan border, stressing full compliance and implementation.

Reaffirms commitment to Sudan and South Sudan's sovereignty, independence, unity, and territorial integrity.

Recognizes the situation in Abyei and along the border as a threat to international peace and security.

Underscores the importance of peacekeeper safety and adequate resourcing for UNISFA.

1. Extends UNISFA's mandate until 15 November 2024, under Chapter VII, and tasks UNISFA to implement its mandate and tasks in accordance with resolutions 2660 (2022), 2630 (2022), and 2609 (2021).

2. Extends UNISFA's support to the Joint Border Verification and Monitoring Mechanism (JBVMM) until 15 November 2024.

3. Maintains authorized troop and police ceilings as set out in resolution 2609 (2021).

4. Urges Sudan and South Sudan to provide full support for UNISFA, facilitate its deployment, and demilitarize the Abyei Area.

5. Requests the Secretary-General to provide written reports on UNISFA's progress by 1 May 2024 and 15 October 2024.

6. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
